when_to_say: When greeting someone
example: Hola, ¿cómo estás? (Hello, how are you?)

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude
example: Gracias por tu ayuda. (Thank you for your help.)

when_to_say: To express affection or deep feelings
example: El amor es lo más importante. (Love is the most important.)

when_to_say: When describing a positive emotional state
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (I am very happy today.)

when_to_say: When describing size
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: When describing a challenging task or situation
example: Este examen es difícil. (This exam is difficult.)

when_to_say: To refer to the next day or the early part of the day
example: Nos vemos mañana. (See you tomorrow.)

when_to_say: When referring to a friend
example: Mi amigo es muy simpático. (My friend is very nice.)

when_to_say: When referring to a book
example: Estoy leyendo un libro. (I am reading a book.)

when_to_say: When talking about a city
example: Vivo en la ciudad. (I live in the city.)

when_to_say: When referring to work or a job
example: Tengo mucho trabajo hoy. (I have a lot of work today.)

when_to_say: When talking about running
example: Me gusta correr en el parque. (I like to run in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to wind or air movement
example: Hace mucho viento hoy. (It is very windy today.)

when_to_say: When something is not in line with the constitution
example: La ley es anticonstitucional. (The law is unconstitutional.)

when_to_say: When describing strength
example: Él es muy fuerte. (He is very strong.)

when_to_say: When talking about freedom or independence
example: La libertad es importante. (Freedom is important.)

when_to_say: When referring to money or currency
example: Necesito dinero. (I need money.)

when_to_say: When referring to a model or typical example
example: Este cambio representa un nuevo paradigma. (This change represents a new paradigm.)

when_to_say: When referring to your family
example: Mi familia es muy unida. (My family is very close.)

when_to_say: When expressing emotions or sensations
example: Siento felicidad. (I feel happiness.)

when_to_say: When describing speed
example: El coche es rápido. (The car is fast.)

when_to_say: When describing color
example: El sol es amarillo. (The sun is yellow.)

when_to_say: When referring to fish as food or animal
example: Me gusta comer pescado. (I like to eat fish.)

when_to_say: When referring to night
example: La noche es tranquila. (The night is calm.)

when_to_say: When talking about a mountain
example: La montaña es alta. (The mountain is tall.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of development
example: Es importante desarrollar nuevas habilidades. (It is important to develop new skills.)

when_to_say: When talking about science or scientific matters
example: La investigación científica es crucial. (Scientific research is crucial.)

when_to_say: When describing something remarkable or out of the ordinary
example: Fue un rendimiento extraordinario. (It was an extraordinary performance.)

when_to_say: When describing something amazing or hard to believe
example: La película fue increíble. (The movie was incredible.)

when_to_say: When describing something that cannot happen
example: Es imposible llegar a tiempo. (It's impossible to arrive on time.)

when_to_say: When describing something that allows light to pass through
example: El vidrio es transparente. (The glass is transparent.)

when_to_say: When talking about building something
example: Vamos a construir una casa. (We are going to build a house.)

when_to_say: When referring to something difficult or challenging
example: El desafío fue difícil, pero lo logré. (The challenge was hard, but I managed.)

when_to_say: When referring to guidance or advice
example: Te daré un buen consejo. (I will give you a good piece of advice.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who is careful or avoids risks
example: Es una persona precavida. (He is a cautious person.)

when_to_say: When talking about committing an action or mistake
example: Cometí un error. (I made a mistake.)

when_to_say: When talking about dedication or responsibility
example: Tenemos un compromiso con el medio ambiente. (We have a commitment to the environment.)

when_to_say: When referring to speed
example: Habla más despacio, por favor. (Speak more slowly, please.)

when_to_say: When referring to termination of employment
example: Recibí un despido de mi trabajo. (I received a dismissal from my job.)

when_to_say: When talking about a favorable moment or chance
example: Esta es una gran oportunidad. (This is a great opportunity.)

when_to_say: When identifying or acknowledging something
example: Reconozco que cometí un error. (I recognize that I made a mistake.)

when_to_say: When referring to the state of being alone
example: La soledad puede ser difícil. (Loneliness can be hard.)

when_to_say: When talking about a struggle or fight for something
example: La lucha por la justicia continúa. (The struggle for justice continues.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that poses risk
example: El peligro es inminente. (The danger is imminent.)

when_to_say: When talking about printing documents or images
example: Necesito imprimir este documento. (I need to print this document.)

when_to_say: When enduring or accepting something unpleasant
example: Es difícil tolerar el ruido. (It’s hard to tolerate the noise.)

when_to_say: When something catches you by surprise
example: Fue una noticia sorprendente. (It was surprising news.)

when_to_say: When describing someone with courage
example: Ella es una persona valiente. (She is a brave person.)

when_to_say: When referring to a book
example: El libro está sobre la mesa. (The book is on the table.)

when_to_say: When describing the size of something
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: When describing speed
example: El tren es rápido. (The train is fast.)

when_to_say: When talking about something unknown or puzzling
example: El caso sigue siendo un misterio. (The case remains a mystery.)

when_to_say: When describing something of worth or importance
example: Este es un objeto muy valioso. (This is a very valuable object.)

when_to_say: When describing discomfort
example: Este asiento es incómodo. (This seat is uncomfortable.)

when_to_say: When referring to something from the past
example: El edificio es muy antiguo. (The building is very old.)

when_to_say: When talking about something vanishing
example: El sol desapareció detrás de las nubes. (The sun disappeared behind the clouds.)

when_to_say: When describing something astonishing or hard to believe
example: Es un espectáculo increíble. (It's an incredible show.)

when_to_say: When referring to a teacher
example: El profesor está explicando la lección. (The teacher is explaining the lesson.)

when_to_say: When describing someone knowledgeable or experienced
example: El anciano es muy sabio. (The elderly man is very wise.)

when_to_say: When referring to how fast something is moving
example: La velocidad del coche es impresionante. (The speed of the car is impressive.)

when_to_say: When describing something unpleasant
example: La película fue horrible. (The movie was horrible.)

when_to_say: When talking about something challenging
example: La dificultad del examen es alta. (The difficulty of the exam is high.)

when_to_say: When talking about a lack of clarity
example: Hubo mucha confusión en la reunión. (There was a lot of confusion in the meeting.)

when_to_say: When referring to happiness or celebration
example: La alegría llenó el aire. (Joy filled the air.)

when_to_say: When talking about exertion or hard work
example: Hizo un gran esfuerzo para terminar a tiempo. (He made a great effort to finish on time.)

when_to_say: When asking or granting forgiveness
example: Te pido perdón por lo que hice. (I ask for forgiveness for what I did.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who shares or gives freely
example: Es muy generoso con su tiempo. (He is very generous with his time.)

when_to_say: When expressing excitement or eagerness
example: El entusiasmo fue evidente en su rostro. (The enthusiasm was evident on his face.)

when_to_say: When talking about a difficult task or obstacle
example: Aceptó el desafío sin dudar. (He accepted the challenge without hesitation.)

when_to_say: When something is complex or hard to understand
example: El problema es muy complicado. (The problem is very complicated.)

when_to_say: When describing someone's emotional state
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (I am very happy today.)

when_to_say: When referring to a friend
example: Juan es mi mejor amigo. (Juan is my best friend.)

when_to_say: When talking about eating food
example: Voy a comer una pizza. (I’m going to eat a pizza.)

when_to_say: When talking about health problems
example: Estoy enfermo, no puedo ir al trabajo. (I am sick, I can't go to work.)

when_to_say: When referring to the sky or heaven
example: El cielo está muy azul hoy. (The sky is very blue today.)

when_to_say: When talking about solving a problem
example: Necesitamos una solución para este problema. (We need a solution for this problem.)

when_to_say: When talking about past events or learning
example: Tengo mucha experiencia en ventas. (I have a lot of experience in sales.)

when_to_say: When referring to a time later than the present
example: Voy a comer después de la reunión. (I’ll eat after the meeting.)

when_to_say: When referring to something coming after
example: El siguiente paso es importante. (The next step is important.)

when_to_say: When talking about development or growth
example: Las plantas crecen rápidamente. (The plants grow quickly.)

when_to_say: When talking about appreciating something or someone
example: Es importante valorar a las personas que tenemos cerca. (It’s important to value the people we have close.)

when_to_say: When identifying or acknowledging something
example: Reconozco que cometí un error. (I recognize that I made a mistake.)

when_to_say: When describing someone’s emotional state
example: Estoy triste por la noticia. (I’m sad about the news.)

when_to_say: When talking about fear or being afraid
example: Temo que no lleguemos a tiempo. (I fear we won’t arrive on time.)

when_to_say: When referring to building something
example: Están construyendo un puente. (They are building a bridge.)

when_to_say: When referring to something extravagant or indulgent
example: Este es un hotel de lujo. (This is a luxury hotel.)

when_to_say: When referring to an action of holding someone closely
example: Voy a abrazar a mi amigo. (I am going to hug my friend.)

when_to_say: When talking about writing
example: Voy a escribir una carta. (I am going to write a letter.)

when_to_say: When referring to learning or reviewing material
example: Necesito estudiar para el examen. (I need to study for the exam.)

when_to_say: When describing someone’s inquisitive nature
example: Ella es muy curiosa sobre el mundo. (She is very curious about the world.)

when_to_say: When describing a craving for sweets or food
example: Él es muy goloso, siempre quiere pastel. (He’s very greedy, he always wants cake.)

when_to_say: When talking about missing someone or something
example: Extraño a mi familia. (I miss my family.)

when_to_say: When referring to waking up from sleep
example: Me despierto a las siete. (I wake up at seven.)

when_to_say: When talking about fighting or struggling with something
example: Luchamos por nuestros derechos. (We fight for our rights.)

when_to_say: When referring to traveling
example: Me gusta viajar por el mundo. (I like to travel around the world.)

when_to_say: When talking about sleeping
example: Voy a dormir temprano esta noche. (I’m going to sleep early tonight.)

when_to_say: When referring to a state of happiness
example: La felicidad es lo más importante. (Happiness is the most important thing.)

when_to_say: When referring to offering assistance
example: Voy a ayudar a mi amigo con la tarea. (I am going to help my friend with the homework.)

when_to_say: When referring to nighttime
example: La noche está muy tranquila. (The night is very calm.)

when_to_say: When referring to making an attempt
example: Intenté solucionar el problema. (I tried to solve the problem.)

when_to_say: When referring to knowing people or places
example: Quiero conocer a tus amigos. (I want to meet your friends.)

when_to_say: When referring to losing something
example: Perdí mi teléfono en el parque. (I lost my phone in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to discovering something new
example: Descubrí un nuevo restaurante. (I discovered a new restaurant.)

when_to_say: When referring to surprising someone
example: Me sorprendió su respuesta. (I was surprised by his answer.)

when_to_say: When referring to the process of development
example: Estamos desarrollando una nueva aplicación. (We are developing a new app.)

when_to_say: When referring to creative thinking
example: La imaginación es clave en la creatividad. (Imagination is key in creativity.)

when_to_say: When thinking deeply about something
example: Necesito reflexionar sobre lo que dijo. (I need to reflect on what he said.)

when_to_say: When referring to a time to come
example: El futuro es incierto. (The future is uncertain.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who shares willingly
example: Es una persona muy generosa. (He/she is a very generous person.)

when_to_say: When referring to a wise person
example: El anciano era muy sabio. (The old man was very wise.)

when_to_say: When referring to concealing something
example: Ocultó la carta en su bolsillo. (He/she hid the letter in his/her pocket.)

when_to_say: When something disappears or fades away
example: Las huellas comenzaron a desvanecerse. (The footprints began to fade.)

when_to_say: When referring to something difficult
example: Tuve dificultad para entender el tema. (I had difficulty understanding the topic.)

when_to_say: When referring to understanding something
example: No entiendo lo que estás diciendo. (I don’t understand what you are saying.)

when_to_say: When referring to making something more difficult
example: El problema se complicó después del error. (The problem became more complicated after the mistake.)

when_to_say: When referring to the feeling of gratitude
example: Te agradezco mucho, aprecio tu ayuda. (I thank you very much, I appreciate your help.)

when_to_say: When referring to a mental or physical disorder
example: Él sufre de un trastorno del sueño. (He suffers from a sleep disorder.)

when_to_say: When describing something that moves or happens slowly
example: El tráfico está muy lento hoy. (The traffic is very slow today.)

when_to_say: When describing a person or animal that is overweight
example: Mi perro es muy gordo. (My dog is very chubby.)

when_to_say: When describing a smart or clever person
example: Ella es muy inteligente. (She is very intelligent.)

when_to_say: When describing something or someone that is beautiful
example: La vista desde la cima es hermosa. (The view from the top is beautiful.)

when_to_say: When referring to making something happen quickly
example: El accidente se precipitó debido a la lluvia. (The accident was precipitated by the rain.)

when_to_say: When referring to understanding something
example: No comprendo lo que me dices. (I don't understand what you're saying to me.)

meaning: To guess correctly, to hit the mark
when_to_say: When referring to guessing or getting something right
example: Acerté en la respuesta. (I guessed the answer correctly.)

when_to_say: When describing something unbelievable or amazing
example: El espectáculo fue increíble. (The show was incredible.)

when_to_say: When referring to focusing on something
example: Necesito enfocar mi atención en el trabajo. (I need to focus my attention on work.)

when_to_say: When replying or answering a question
example: Voy a responder a tu pregunta. (I’m going to respond to your question.)

when_to_say: When referring to something or someone becoming visible
example: El sol comenzó a aparecer detrás de las nubes. (The sun began to appear behind the clouds.)

when_to_say: When referring to influencing or impacting something
example: El clima afecta mi salud. (The weather affects my health.)

meaning: To strive, to make an effort
when_to_say: When referring to putting in effort towards something
example: Debes esforzarte más para mejorar. (You must strive harder to improve.)

when_to_say: When acknowledging or identifying someone or something
example: Reconozco su esfuerzo. (I recognize his/her effort.)

when_to_say: When describing someone with a desire to learn or know more
example: Es una persona muy curiosa. (He/she is a very curious person.)

when_to_say: When referring to enduring or accepting something
example: No puedo tolerar el frío. (I can’t tolerate the cold.)

when_to_say: When confronting someone or something with a challenge
example: Desafiaré a mi hermano en el juego. (I will challenge my brother in the game.)

when_to_say: When translating from one language to another
example: Voy a traducir este texto al español. (I will translate this text into Spanish.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of betraying someone
example: La traición de su amigo fue dolorosa. (The betrayal of his friend was painful.)

when_to_say: When offering an idea or recommendation
example: Voy a sugerir un cambio en el plan. (I am going to suggest a change to the plan.)

when_to_say: When referring to something made artificially
example: Este material es sintético, no es natural. (This material is synthetic, not natural.)

when_to_say: When bringing up an idea or question for consideration
example: Voy a plantear una nueva propuesta. (I’m going to propose a new idea.)

when_to_say: When referring to something extremely bad or cruel
example: La guerra causó atrocidades. (The war caused atrocities.)

when_to_say: When describing a situation that is unlucky or regrettable
example: Fue un día desafortunado para todos. (It was an unfortunate day for everyone.)

when_to_say: When thinking deeply about something
example: Pasó horas contemplando el paisaje. (He/she spent hours contemplating the landscape.)

when_to_say: When stopping someone from speaking or doing something
example: No debes interrumpir mientras hablo. (You shouldn’t interrupt while I’m talking.)

when_to_say: When something falls apart or loses its structure
example: La vieja casa comenzó a desmoronarse. (The old house started to crumble.)

when_to_say: When something is surprising or awe-inspiring
example: La vista desde la cima es asombrosa. (The view from the top is amazing.)

when_to_say: When referring to a deep yearning or desire
example: Tengo un anhelo de viajar por el mundo. (I have a longing to travel the world.)

when_to_say: When someone does not follow the rules
example: El niño desobedeció las instrucciones. (The child disobeyed the instructions.)

when_to_say: When referring to a state of doubt or lack of certainty
example: La incertidumbre sobre el futuro es difícil de manejar. (The uncertainty about the future is hard to handle.)

when_to_say: When offering an idea or recommendation
example: Su sugerencia fue muy útil. (His/her suggestion was very helpful.)

when_to_say: When referring to a question or doubt
example: Tengo un interrogante sobre el tema. (I have a question about the topic.)

when_to_say: When describing water or a situation that is unclear
example: El agua del río estaba turbia. (The river water was murky.)

when_to_say: When describing something extremely large or vast
example: El océano es inmenso. (The ocean is immense.)

when_to_say: When referring to a feeling of deep sadness or longing
example: Un aire de melancolía llenaba la habitación. (An air of melancholy filled the room.)

when_to_say: When something happens unexpectedly
example: Hubo un imprevisto durante el viaje. (There was an unforeseen event during the trip.)

when_to_say: When giving the meaning or description of something
example: Voy a definir el término para ti. (I will define the term for you.)

when_to_say: When referring to a sign or warning of something that might happen
example: El cielo oscuro era un presagio de tormenta. (The dark sky was an omen of a storm.)

when_to_say: When making something look more beautiful
example: La decoración embellece la habitación. (The decoration beautifies the room.)

when_to_say: When reducing pain or discomfort
example: Este medicamento aliviará el dolor. (This medication will relieve the pain.)

when_to_say: When something is clearly visible or obvious
example: Es evidente que él no está feliz. (It is evident that he is not happy.)

when_to_say: When removing liquid from something
example: Debes escurrir el exceso de agua. (You should drain the excess water.)

when_to_say: When making something known or uncovering it
example: El investigador desveló la verdad. (The investigator revealed the truth.)

when_to_say: When describing something of exceptional beauty or excellence
example: La vista desde la montaña es sublime. (The view from the mountain is sublime.)

when_to_say: When covering something or giving it a coating
example: Este material reviste una capa de protección. (This material covers a layer of protection.)

when_to_say: When something is impossible to imagine or understand
example: Es inconcebible que no hayas escuchado esa noticia. (It’s inconceivable that you haven’t heard that news.)

when_to_say: When something causes a feeling of disappointment or discouragement
example: La noticia fue muy desalentadora. (The news was very discouraging.)

when_to_say: When something is against the constitution or law
example: La propuesta fue declarada anticonstitucional. (The proposal was declared unconstitutional.)

when_to_say: When something is not understandable
example: El discurso era completamente ininteligible. (The speech was completely incomprehensible.)

when_to_say: When something is out of proportion or excessive
example: La respuesta fue desproporcionada. (The response was disproportionate.)

when_to_say: When two things cannot be brought back together or reconciled
example: Sus diferencias eran irreconciliables. (Their differences were irreconcilable.)

when_to_say: When something is out of control or excessive
example: La fiesta fue desenfrenada y caótica. (The party was unrestrained and chaotic.)

when_to_say: When referring to a trick performed with the hands, especially in magic
example: El mago sorprendió a todos con su prestidigitación. (The magician surprised everyone with his sleight of hand.)

when_to_say: When something cannot be argued against or disproven
example: Su evidencia era irrefutable. (His evidence was irrefutable.)

when_to_say: When referring to a technique used to aid memory
example: Usamos un truco mnemotécnico para recordar los números. (We used a mnemonic trick to remember the numbers.)

when_to_say: When something cannot be replaced
example: Su ayuda fue insustituible en ese momento. (His/her help was irreplaceable at that moment.)

when_to_say: When something is undeniable or cannot be contested
example: La evidencia es incontestable. (The evidence is incontestable.)

when_to_say: When referring to a trick or deception used to achieve something
example: Usaron un subterfugio para escapar. (They used subterfuge to escape.)

when_to_say: When something seems contradictory but may actually be true
example: Es paradójico que, a pesar de su esfuerzo, fallara. (It’s paradoxical that, despite his effort, he failed.)

when_to_say: When someone has a feeling of superiority or contempt for others
example: Lo miraba con desdén. (He/she looked at him with disdain.)

when_to_say: When two things are in direct opposition
example: Sus ideas eran antagónicas. (Their ideas were antagonistic.)

when_to_say: When referring to the conclusion or result of a situation
example: El desenlace de la historia fue inesperado. (The outcome of the story was unexpected.)

when_to_say: When referring to a deep sadness or sorrow
example: Sentía una melancolía profunda. (He/she felt a deep melancholy.)

when_to_say: When someone is willing to compromise or be flexible
example: Ella es muy transigente cuando se trata de diferencias. (She is very tolerant when it comes to differences.)

when_to_say: When giving power or authority to someone
example: El curso está diseñado para empoderar a los jóvenes. (The course is designed to empower young people.)

when_to_say: When something is customary or habitual
example: Es consuetudinario celebrar esa fiesta cada año. (It is customary to celebrate this festival every year.)

when_to_say: When something or someone cannot be satisfied or filled
example: Tiene una ambición insaciable. (He/she has an insatiable ambition.)

when_to_say: When someone has a natural tendency or inclination towards something
example: Tiene una proclividad por el arte. (He/she has a proclivity for art.)

when_to_say: When someone is unwilling to change their opinions or views
example: Él es intransigente cuando se trata de política. (He is intransigent when it comes to politics.)

when_to_say: When something is short-lived or transient
example: La belleza de la flor es efímera. (The beauty of the flower is ephemeral.)

when_to_say: When something or someone is not known or is hidden
example: El paradero de la persona sigue incógnito. (The whereabouts of the person remain unknown.)

when_to_say: When protecting something from harm or danger
example: Debemos salvaguardar el medio ambiente. (We must safeguard the environment.)

when_to_say: When something causes discomfort or worry
example: El documental fue perturbador. (The documentary was disturbing.)

when_to_say: When something has an unfortunate outcome or situation
example: Fue un desafortunado accidente. (It was an unfortunate accident.)

when_to_say: When someone shows no emotion or reaction
example: Se mantuvo impasible durante toda la reunión. (He/she remained impassive throughout the meeting.)

when_to_say: When something continues to exist for a long time
example: Su legado perdurará por generaciones. (His/her legacy will endure for generations.)

when_to_say: When something is officially canceled or reversed
example: La revocación de la ley causó gran controversia. (The revocation of the law caused great controversy.)

when_to_say: When something is too large or extreme
example: El gasto fue desmesurado. (The spending was excessive.)

when_to_say: When someone refuses to compromise
example: La intransigencia de ambas partes llevó al fracaso. (The intransigence of both parties led to failure.)

when_to_say: When someone is cruel and oppressive in their rule or actions
example: El régimen despótico controlaba todo. (The despotic regime controlled everything.)

when_to_say: When something is impossible to endure
example: El calor era insoportable. (The heat was unbearable.)

when_to_say: When something brings misfortune or disaster
example: Fue un día nefasto para la economía. (It was a disastrous day for the economy.)
